payload.name: belief-revision
payload.core: Formal framework for modifying beliefs when new information conflicts. AGM postulates define expansion (+A), contraction (-A), and revision (*A) with minimal change constraint.
proc: enumerate belief set K: list accepted propositions
identify incoming A: state new proposition and direct conflicts
rank entrenchment: foundational vs revisable beliefs
compute minimal contractions: smallest sets restoring K+A consistency
execute revision: apply contraction, add A, document drops

diff.bayesian: updates acceptance in/out vs degrees of belief
diff.non-monotonic: restructures belief set vs handles defaults at inference
diff.defeasible: operates on propositions vs defeat relations between rules

signals: peripheral drops fail to restore consistency

ex.sit: Beliefs: all swans white, this bird is swan, white reflects light. Observe: this bird is black.
steps: K = {all swans white, this is swan, white reflects light}
A = this bird is black, contradicts via swan + all-swans-white
options: drop all-swans-white OR drop this-is-swan
revise: drop all-swans-white (lower entrenchment), add A
ex.insight: generalization most revisable as induction, not definition or observation
